intro: Oldenlandia thesiifolia f. albiflora, commonly known as the white-flowered spiderwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, herbaceous stems and small, clustered leaves that are often opposite in arrangement. The plant produces delicate, white or pale yellow flowers with five petals, which bloom in clusters during the summer months. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardeners seeking a shade-tolerant, flowering plant.
